BiblioData.Title: ORGANIC LIGHT EMITTING DIODES WITH STRUCTURED ELECTRODES

Applicant.Name: UNIV CALIFORNIA [US]
THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA

BiblioData.Abstract: A cathode that contain nanostructures that extend into the organic layer of an OLED has been described. The cathode can have an array of nanotubes or a layer of nanoclusters extending out from its surface. In another arrangement, the cathode is patterned and etched to form protruding nanostructures using a standard lithographic process. Various methods for fabricating these structures are provided, all of which are compatible with large-scale manufacturing. OLEDs made with these novel electrodes have greatly enhanced electron injection, have good environmental stability.

Claims.P: 1. An structured electrode, comprising: a plurality of nanostructures extending outwardly from the electrode.
2. The electrode of claim 1, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of carbon nanotubes.
3. The electrode of claim 2, wherein each of the plurality of carbon nanotubes have a sharp tip.
4. The electrode of claim 1 , wherein each of the plurality of nanostructures further comprise an alkali composite.
5. The electrode of claim 1, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of nanoclusters.
6. The electrode of claim 5, wherein the plurality of nanoclusters comprise at least one metallic alloy.
7. The electrode of claim 1, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of lithographically-defined nanostructures .

8. An organic light emitting diode device, comprising: a cathode comprising a plurality of nanostructures extending outwardly from the cathode; an organic layer coupled to the cathode nanostructures, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is positioned substantially within the organic layer.
9. The device of claim 8, further comprising an anode coupled to the organic layer.
10. The device of claim 9, further comprising a substrate coupled to the anode.
11. The device of claim 8, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of carbon nanotubes.
12. The electrode of claim 11, wherein each of the plurality of carbon nanotubes have a sharp tip.
13. The electrode of claim 8, wherein each of the plurality of nanostructures further comprises an alkali composite.
14. The electrode of claim 8, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of nanoclusters.
15. The electrode of claim 14, wherein the plurality of nanoclusters comprise at least one metal alloy.
16. The electrode of claim 8, wherein the plurality of nanostructures is a plurality of lithographically-defined nanostructures .
